meanings.definition: The tough outer layer of a fruit or vegetable.
meanings.sent2: She peeled the apple rind before eating it.
meanings.sent3: The watermelon rind made a funny hat.
meanings.sent4: The rind of the lemon added a zesty touch to the dish.
meanings.sent5: The thick rind protected the juicy fruit inside.

meanings.sent1: The Parmesan rind can be used to flavor soups.
meanings.sent2: He cut off the cheddar rind before slicing the cheese.
meanings.sent3: The cheese rind looked like a tiny wall around the cheese.
meanings.sent4: The brie rind added a creamy texture to the cheese.
meanings.sent5: The rind of the cheese had a strong aroma.

meanings.definition: To remove the outer layer of something.
meanings.sent1: She will rind the cucumber for the salad.
meanings.sent2: He rinds the oranges carefully to avoid wasting the fruit.
meanings.sent3: Rinding the potato was a messy task.
meanings.sent4: The chef rinds the lemon zest for the dessert.
meanings.sent5: They rind the bark off the tree to make furniture.
